results.title: Celebration of the senses: a profile of Eric Rolls
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Looks at the life, work and world of Eric Rolls through his senses. He reads from his own writings and shows how he uses the senses in descriptive narrative. Describes the way in which he senses the world with hearing, sight, taste, smell and touch.

results.title: Celebration
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker, William Weintraub and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A portrait of Canada in many moods, costumes, and poses, on the eve of its one hundredth birthday. These are still pictures, hundreds of them, from the northernmost igloo to the southernmost meadow - pictures of people, places, activities, all with the style, the flair to fit the celebration. The music of the Oscar Peterson Trio is featured in the film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rex Tasker, William Weintraub and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Celebrating whole language
results.creator_credit: Dennis Claringbold, Keith Pigdon, Marilyn Woolley, Steve Macdonald and Melbourne College of Advanced Education. Media Production Centre
results.brief_description: Professors Ken and Yetta Goodman are interviewed by Howard Mould, Pat Long and Marilyn Woolley about the “Whole Language Approach” to language learning. The interviews are intercut with scenes of the Goodmans in classrooms in Victoria which illustrate their child-centred approach. A useful resource for parent-teacher evenings, professional development, curriculum days and ELIC courses.

results.title: Caught in the net
results.creator_credit: David Tennant, Lori Roth, Nathan Neumer, National Film Board of Canada and Still Water Pictures
results.brief_description: A thought provoking short documentary about exercising caution when developing friendships over the Internet and for the level of information that is disclosed. It does this through a discussion between two friends who have met and become friends in real life. This is compared to the relationship that is developing between one of them and someone he has ‘met’ over the Internet in a discussion room and via email. It questions issues such as what information is volunteered, what is held back, intuition, and whose on the other end of this unknown and faceless form of communication.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Tennant, Lori Roth, Nathan Neumer, National Film Board of Canada and Still Water Pictures

results.title: Catskinner Keen
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, John Smith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “West”.
Bob Keen is almost larger than life - big in stature, self-made millionaire, already part of the legend of the Northwest. His fortunes began with a second-hand caterpillar tractor, bulldozing mountain roads. Now he owns - oil land, operates road, water and air transport, flies a plane, drives a chuckwagon, and is listed on the stock exchange. For all that, he’s a modest man who still likes yarning by a campfire with old cowpuncher pals in the big game country of the Rockies. (Award: Hollywood)

results.title: Catuor
results.creator_credit: Judith Klein, Pierre Heberrt and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film is about cats - actually, one very clever cat. The title is a play on the French “quatuor” meaning quartet, but the chorus is not the usual alley cat variety. The cat in this film is talented indeed. It is both pianist and piano, trumpet and trumpeter, and, if need be, even becomes the music - a pulsing rock and roll - or a whole swarm of alley cats. Award: Madrid

results.title: We're here to stay
results.creator_credit: Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “West”.
That is the resolve of Agri-Pool, seven farm families in Lestock, Saskatchewan, who have pooled their resources so that rising operating costs will not drive them off their land. By pooling their land, their equipment, their livestock, and farming as a cooperative, they are able to live as they choose, to maintain their standard of living, and even to have some spare time left over to enjoy. This is an engaging look at a novel approach to big-scale farming.

results.title: Cattle ranch
results.creator_credit: Guy L. Cote, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The life of the cowboy, filmed through the seasons on Canada’s biggest cattle ranch near Kanloops, British Colombia. With musical accompaniment by American folk singer Peter Seeger and narration by Frances Hyland, ‘Cattle Ranch’ presents a vividly dramatic picture of the open range where a cowboy is king, where calves are born, live with the herd for a time in the splendour of mountain meadows, then join the trek to the city abattoir. Awards: Locarno; Rome; Vancouver; Montreal

results.title: World of pets
results.creator_credit: Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: This series looks at the main issues facing children in regards to the care and treatment of the most popular animals they may wish to keep as pets. Suitable for Middle-Upper Primary level students.
